result.execSummary:
The defendant Kole T. Packard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kole T. Packard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kole T. Packard in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15FO347 & 15CM260.  Called at 11:13 am  Atty Bayne Allison has authority to dispose of city citation.  Plea agreement stated.  Move to dismiss 15FO347.  Plea to 15CM260, fine with jail consecutive to previous sentence.    Credit 1 day.  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed.  15CM260 ct 1 - No contest plea entered.  Court will dismiss 15FO347.   Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements reviewed.  Court finds def plea entered freely & voluntarily.  Court finds def understand charge, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for plea.  Court will accept plea, found guilty.  State presents sentencing recommendations.  Atty Koppelman presents sentencing arguments, requesting fine & cost and no jail.  If jail, run concurrent.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by Court.  Court orders 4 days jail, credit 1 day.  Can be served in any county.  Commencing no later than 8-1-16.  Court cost plus DNA surcharge.  DNA sample unless already provided.  Bond applied and balance to poster.  Huber privileges.  Jail time consecutive to any other sentence.  Post conviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Written Authorization to Appear and Plead Not Guilty

Attorney James Charles Koppelman in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawn Behrens appeared for the City of Antigo. Court calls15CM260 & 15FO347  @ 1:34 pm. Atty Koppelman enters Not Guilty plea on new charge & Not Guilty on 15FO347. 15CM260 Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond, already posted.  Atty Koppelman will be given bond & get def's signature & return to court.  No use of alcohol condition.  Atty Koppleman objects to condition.  State would request condition.  Court will order condition. Def. does not have to appear for Status.  Atty Koppleman can appear by phone. 15FO347 off the record. Atty Behrens  would like to follow criminal case.  Court will have City case track criminal case.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Written Authorization to Appear and Plead Not Guilty
Written Authorization to Appear and Plead Not Guilty - Fax copy - See 15FO347
